data.meta_description:
1,900 likes, 63 comments - theaidsmemorial on December 1, 2023: "üá∫üá∏ ‚ÄúThe irony of my father‚Äôs death in 1986 was that for someone who lived his life to the fullest and without any shame, he would die of disease that unnecessarily carried shame and stigma due to political and societal ignorance. 

There is not a day that goes by since John Daniel Lugo, Sr (1955 - 1986) passed that I don‚Äôt think of him. That I don‚Äôt wonder what he would have thought of today‚Äôs world, the events, the music. Even though I was barely 10 when he passed, I could still hear the way he would call me ‚Äúlittle Johnny‚Äù in that way that was more like a buddy than a dad but with the unconditional love that only a parent can give.

I‚Äôm not sure what Heaven looks like but I am sure it plays salsa music and you‚Äôre there with that smile and those dance moves, making sure everyone is having a good time. Love you Pop!‚Äù ‚Äî by John Lugo-Trebble @jlugotrebblewriter #worldaidsday #worldaidsday2023 #whatisrememberedlives".
